meanings.definition: A type of dance originating in Brazil.
meanings.sent1: At the party, everyone joined in the lambadas on the dance floor.
meanings.sent2: The music played, and the dancers moved gracefully in the lambadas.
meanings.sent3: The lambadas at the festival were so energetic, they made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for lambadas was like a fire burning brightly in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the costumes added to the beauty of the lambadas.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'lambada'.
meanings.sent1: In the library, I found many books discussing different lambadas.
meanings.sent2: The collection showcased various lambadas from around the world.
meanings.sent3: The shelves were filled with lambadas, making it hard to choose just one.
meanings.sent4: The room echoed with the whispers of countless lambadas waiting to be read.
meanings.sent5: The diversity of lambadas on display was truly impressive.
